content:
This is probably a bug report but I don't know how to reliably reproduce it nor minimize it, so there could be something else going on... anyway

When I type proof around https://github.com/wwylele/Poncelet/blob/13d90d0bb661f0f14fd683cea09d58ca15b07185/Poncelet/Elliptic.lean#L167, because it is in the middle of the file, naturally all the proof below is re-checked. When it happens, the next lemma, specifically the grind at 204 (probably, because I never cleanly narrowed it down to one line), occasionally gets stuck, and very quickly freezes my entire computer within a few seconds. It is not a total freeze, as I can still move my cursor very slowly (and my background music still plays some sound once a minute), but basically nothing responds till I do a hard reboot. I guessed that this is RAM exhaustion, as I have experienced similar things before when I know I accidentally allocated a lot of memory, but I don't have direct evidence for this. It has happened 4 times within an hour at the same place, so at least this part is consistent.

Some basic information:
OS: Ubuntu 24.04.3
Processor: Intel i7-11700
Memory: 16 GB
Lean tool chain: v4.26.0-rc2
